department.en: Department of Computer Science and Elec. Engineering

goal.en: 1. This course will present an overview of several distributed computing models 2. This course will assume familiarity with Java/C programming and operating systems
goal.ch: 1. This course will present an overview of several distributed computing models 2. This course will assume familiarity with Java/C programming and operating systems

content.en:
“Distributed Computing Model Overview,
Concurrency and Consistency,
Java Sockets,
Java threads and synchronization,
Message Passing Interface (MPI),
Concept of Mobile Code and Mobile Agent,
Actor Model and SALSA Programming Language,
Lambda-calculus and Petri-Net,
Pi-Calculus,
Mobile Ambients,
Join-Calculus,
Global State Detection
“
content.ch:
“Distributed Computing Model Overview,
Concurrency and Consistency,
Java Sockets,
Java threads and synchronization,
Message Passing Interface (MPI),
Concept of Mobile Code and Mobile Agent,
Actor Model and SALSA Programming Language,
Lambda-calculus and Petri-Net,
Pi-Calculus,
Mobile Ambients,
Join-Calculus,
Global State Detection
“

grading.en:
“There will be one exam which will count 35％ of the course grade. There will be approximately 2~3 individual assignments, which will together count 35％ of the course grade. Students will be asked to present selected papers, which will count 30％ of the course grade.
“
grading.ch:
“There will be one exam which will count 35％ of the course grade. There will be approximately 2~3 individual assignments, which will together count 35％ of the course grade. Students will be asked to present selected papers, which will count 30％ of the course grade.
“

en: Department:MSc in Computer Science and Information Engineering、Institute of Software Engineering、Master‘s Program in Artificial Intelligence, Department of Computer Science and Information Engineering、PhD in Computer Science and Information Engineering only.
